info.name: CMS 3.0 API collection
info.description:
Cisco Meeting Server API collection, organized according to CMS API Guide structure.
See https://github.com/ciscocms/cms-postman-collection for instructions on how to use this collection.

Further details: 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/conferencing/meeting-server/products-programming-reference-guides-list.html
https://developer.cisco.com/site/cisco-meeting-server/

---

## Authors: Steve Kapinos, Zoltan Kelemen

look for latest version on https://github.com/ciscocms/cms-postman-collection

query.description: An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve coSpaces other than the first “page” in the notional list.
Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those coSpaces that match the filter
Supply “tenantFilter=<tenant id>” to return just those coSpaces associated with that tenant
Supply “callLegProfileFilter=<call leg profile id>” to return just those coSpaces using that call leg profile

request.description: The response includes the total count of the number of coSpaces present which match the filter if provided, irrespective of the number returned within the response. (With no filter, this value is the total number of configured coSpaces.)

urlencoded.description: The human-readable name that will be shown on clients’ UI for this coSpace
The URI that a SIP system would use to dial in to this coSpace
The secondary URI for this coSpace – this provide the same functionality as the “uri” parameter, but allows more than one URI to be configured for a coSpace
The numeric ID that a user would enter at the IVR (or via a web client) to connect to this coSpace

Up to 100 characters of free form text to identify this coSpace in a CDR; when a “callStart” CDR is generated for a call associated with this coSpace, this tag will be written (as “cdrTag”) to the callStart CDR. See the Cisco Meeting Server CDR Reference for details. The cdrTag can be modified in a PUT method.
The security code for this coSpace
The default layout to be used for new call legs in this coSpace. See Default layout options for the difference in naming between the API and the Web Admin interface
If provided, associates the specified tenant with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call leg profile with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call profile with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call branding profile with this coSpace
If this value is supplied as true, and no callId is currently specified for the coSpace, a new auto-generated call Id will be assigned

If provided, sets the security string for this coSpace. If absent, a security string is chosen automatically if the coSpace has a callId value. This is the security value associated with the coSpace that needs to be supplied with the callId for guest access to the coSpace.
Controls whether non-members of the coSpace are able to have access to the coSpace. If not provided, behaviour defaults to true. (From version 2.0).
Indicates the coSpace is owned by the user with the specified JID. (From version 2.0).
Indicates where the coSpace is streamed to, if streaming is initiated. (From version 2.1).
If provided, the coSpace will be owned by the user with the given AD GUID. (From version 2.1).
Name of person (not necessarily a user) who scheduled the creation of this coSpace, which if set is propagated to any call objects as the “ownerName” field. (From version 2.2).
If provided, pane placement will be activated for this specific coSpace - the active range of importance values will be from "highest importance" down to 1 (inclusive). From version 2.4.
If pane placement is activated, this defines the layout behavior for this coSpace when viewing an endpoint's own layout pane. (From version 2.7)

request.description: Creating: POST method to the “/coSpaces” node. If the coSpace was created successfully,  a “200 OK” response is received, and the “Location” header contains the ID for the new  coSpace

urlencoded.description: The human-readable name that will be shown on clients’ UI for this coSpace
The URI that a SIP system would use to dial in to this coSpace
The secondary URI for this coSpace – this provide the same functionality as the “uri” parameter, but allows more than one URI to be configured for a coSpace
The numeric ID that a user would enter at the IVR (or via a web client) to connect to this coSpace

Up to 100 characters of free form text to identify this coSpace in a CDR; when a “callStart” CDR is generated for a call associated with this coSpace, this tag will be written (as “cdrTag”) to the callStart CDR. See the Cisco Meeting Server CDR Reference for details. The cdrTag can be modified in a PUT method.
The default layout to be used for new call legs in this coSpace. See Default layout options for the difference in naming between the API and the Web Admin interface
If provided, associates the specified tenant with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call leg profile with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call profile with this coSpace
If provided, associates the specified call branding profile with this coSpace
If this value is supplied as true, and no callId is currently specified for the coSpace, a new auto-generated call Id will be assigned

If provided, sets the security string for this coSpace. If absent, a security string is chosen automatically if the coSpace has a callId value. This is the security value associated with the coSpace that needs to be supplied with the callId for guest access to the coSpace.

* If provided as true - a new security value is generated for this coSpace and the former value is no longer valid (for instance, any hyperlinks including it will cease to work) * l If provided as false - do not generate a new secret value for this coSpace; this has no effect This parameter is only valid for the modify (PUT) case.
Controls whether non-members of the coSpace are able to have access to the coSpace. If not provided, behaviour defaults to true. (From version 2.0).
Indicates the coSpace is owned by the user with the specified JID. (From version 2.0).
Indicates where the coSpace is streamed to, if streaming is initiated. (From version 2.1).
If provided, the coSpace will be owned by the user with the given AD GUID. (From version 2.1).
Name of person (not necessarily a user) who scheduled the creation of this coSpace, which if set is propagated to any call objects as the “ownerName” field. (From version 2.2).

If panePlacementHighestImportance is provided, pane placement will be activated for this coSpace - the active range of importance values will be from “highest importance” down to 1(inclusive). (From version 2.4)
Name of person (not necessarily a user) who scheduled the creation of this coSpace, which if set is propagated to any call objects as the 'ownerName" field. (From version 2.2)
If provided, pane placement will be activated for this specific coSpace - the active range of importance values will be from "highest importance" down to 1 (inclusive). From version 2.4.
If pane placement is activated, this defines the layout behavior for this coSpace when viewing an endpoint's own layout pane. (From version 2.7)

request.description: Modifying: PUT method on a “/coSpaces/<coSpace ID>” node

From version 2.1, a meetingEntryDetail node is added to allow retrieval of entry details for a specific coSpace meeting. Perform a GET on /coSpaces//meeting EntryDetail. Response values are uri and callId.

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those coSpaceUsers that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve coSpaceUsers other than the first “page” in the notional list.
Supply “callLegProfileFilter=<call leg profile id>” to return just those coSpaceUsers using that call leg profile

urlencoded.description: JID of the user to be added as a member. required
Whether this user is allowed to change the "non-member access allowed setting" of the coSpace. From version 2.3

request.description: GET method performed on a “/coSpaces/<coSpace ID>/coSpaceUsers/<coSpaceUser ID>” node. If the retrieval is valid, a “200 OK” response is received, with containing a single <coSpaceUser id=<ID>> object with data as described above for the creating and modifying case. In addition    * the autoGenerated value shows whether the coSpace member was added to the coSpace automatically as part of an LDAP sync operation  * the canDeleteAllMessages shows whether this member is allowed to delete chat in the coSpace

GET method performed on a “/coSpaces/<coSpace ID>/coSpaceUsers/<coSpaceUser ID>” node. If the retrieval is valid, a “200 OK” response is received, with containing a single <coSpaceUser id=<ID>> object with data as described above for the creating and modifying case. In addition    * the autoGenerated value shows whether the coSpace member was added to the coSpace automatically as part of an LDAP sync operation  * the canDeleteAllMessages shows whether this member is allowed to delete chat in the coSpace

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those accessMethods that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve accessMethods other than the first “page” in the notional list.
Supply “callLegProfileFilter=<call leg profile id>” to return just those coSpaces using that call leg profile

urlencoded.description: The URI to be used for dialing in via this access method. (The URI “user part” is the part before any '@' character in a full URI.)
Name this accessMethod
The “call ID” to be used for connecting via this access method (using the IVR or Web Bridge login)
A passcode required for this access method
The importance value assigned to all participants joining via this access method. Maximum value is 2,147,483,647. (From version 2.4)
The URI to be used for dialing in via this access method. (The URI “user part” is the part before any '@' character in a full URI.)
Name this accessMethod
The “call ID” to be used for connecting via this access method (using the IVR or Web Bridge login)
A passcode required for this access method
The ID of a call leg profile to apply to calls in via this access method

If provided, sets the security string for this coSpace access method. If absent, a security string is chosen automatically if the coSpace access method has a callId value.  This is the security value associated with the coSpace access method that needs to be supplied with the callId for guest access to the coSpace via this access method.

* If provided as true - a new security value is generated for this coSpace access method and the former value is no longer valid (for instance, any hyperlinks including it will cease to work)
* If provided as false - do not generate a new secret value for this coSpace access method; this has no effect.

The visibility of this coSpace access method to users of Cisco Meeting App who are members of the coSpace

* If provided as public - details of this coSpace access method can be made available to members of the coSpace
* If provided as private - details of this coSpace access method will not be made available to members of the coSpace

Note: if you set the scope to public then the Cisco Meeting App can no longer edit the coSpace details. In addition, the uri shown under the name is that from the access method.
The importance value assigned to all participants joining via this access method. Maximum value is 2,147,483,647. (From version 2.4)

Index that coSpace mappings end at (inclusive)

query.description: specify to return just those coSpaces access methods that use the specified call leg profile

urlencoded.description: Name this access template

the expression to be used to generate URI values for this access method template; the allowed set of characters are 'a'to'z','A'to'Z','0'to'9','.','-','_'and'$'; if nonempty it must contain exactly one'$'character
whether to generate a unique numeric ID for this access method which overrides the global one for the cospace. default to False.
Name this access template

the expression to be used to generate URI values for this access method template; the allowed set of characters are 'a'to'z','A'to'Z','0'to'9','.','-','_'and'$'; if nonempty it must contain exactly one'$'character
whether to generate a unique numeric ID for this access method which overrides the global one for the cospace. default to False.

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those outboundDialPlanRules that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve outboundDialPlanRules other than the first “page” in the notional list.
If supplied, this filter only returns those outbound dial plan rules associated with the specified tenant.

urlencoded.description: beta feature
beta feature

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those outboundDialPlanRules that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve outboundDialPlanRules other than the first “page” in the notional list.

item.name: Incoming Call Matching Dial Plan Methods

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those inboundDialPlanRules that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve inboundDialPlanRules other than the first “page” in the notional list.
Supply tenantFilter to return only those inbound dial plan rules associated with the specified tenant

item.name: Incoming Call Forwarding Dial Plan Methods

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those forwardingDialPlanRules that match the filter
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve forwardingDialPlanRules other than the first “page” in the notional list.
If supplied, this filter restricts the results returned to those forwarding dial plan rules that are associated with the specified tenant

An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve coSpaces other than the
first “page” in the notional list
Supply an ID to return just those calls that match the filter
Supply an ID to return just those calls that belong to the specified tenant

urlencoded.description: One of these three MUST be set in creation: Name, coSpace, callCorrelator
One of these three MUST be set in creation: Name, coSpace, callCorrelator
One of these three MUST be set in creation: Name, coSpace, callCorrelator
If set, this will override the coSpace counterpart
If set, this will override the coSpace counterpart

request.description: POST method performed on “/calls/<call id>/diagnostics” generates call diagnostics for the call  in question.

query.description:
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve active participants other than the
first “page” in the notional list
Supply an ID to return just those active participants that match the filter
Supply an ID to return just those active participants that belong to the specified tenant.
Supply an ID to return just those active participants located on the specified Call Bridge.

item.name: Creating a new participant for a specific call

urlencoded.description: Specifies the call leg’s address; this could be a SIP URI, a phone number, or a user JID to invite that user to the call
At least one of these two must be set in creation: remoteParty, movedParticipant
if supplied, sets the bandwidth for the call leg, in bits per second (e.g. 2000000 for 2Mbit/s). If not supplied, the Call Bridge configured value will be used

if supplied, this overrides the automatic choice of whether to require a confirmation from the remote party to join the call. true - always require a confirmation from the remote party; typically this takes the form of a voice prompt requiring them to hit a key to join. false - never require a confirmation from the remote party; the remote party will be joinIf supplied must be an ID for the Meeting Server to associate with this call leg. This will be returned by the Meeting Server when the call leg is later queried and therefore should be a value that has meaning to the requestored into the coSpace when they accept the incoming call

If supplied must be an ID for the Meeting Server to associate with this call leg. This will be returned by the Meeting Server when the call leg is later queried and therefore should be a value that has meaning to the requestor

If provided, associates the specified call leg profile with this call leg. You can also supply individual values for all parameters that can be part of a call leg profile to override this call leg profiles’ value.

This parameter is provided for backward compatibility with early versions of Meeting Server - it has the equivalent functionality to changing “defaultLayout“, and if both are supplied then “defaultLayout” will take precedence
(From version 2.3)
If supplied, attempt to add the participant from the specified Call Bridge (from version 2.2).
If supplied, attempt to add the participant from the specified Call Bridge Group (from version 2.2).
The importance value of the participant to be created. Maximum value is 2,147,483,647. To remove importance leave the importance parameter as unset (leave value as blank). (From version 2.2)

If supplied, overrides the name for this participant. Setting an empty string clears the value and restores the original name. Overriding the name of a participant and its associated call leg(s) is interchangeable and affects both; the latest change takes precedence. It changes the name of the participant in the following: on-screen name label viewed by other conference participants, ActiveControl roster list, any place that the Meeting App sees the, name of the participant in a call, CDR records, where the name appears in the web interface. (From version 2.4)

A sequence of DTMF key press commands to send to the far end either when the participant is initially created or during the call. The DTMF sequence is played out from the Call Bridge where the call for this participant is placed. In the supplied sequence, you can use the digits 0 to 9, * and #, as well as one or more comma characters (“,“) which add a pause between digits. (From version 2.4)

request.description:
***Note:***: Due to load balancing across clustered Meeting Servers, an explicit selection of a Call Bridge or Call Bridge Group or from configured dial plan rules, may result in the call leg instantiation (“owned” by the participant object) occurring on a remote clustered Call Bridge.

See also the section on participant related methods.

item.name: Modify a participant for a specific call

urlencoded.description: This parameter is provided for backward compatibility with early versions of Meeting Server - it has the equivalent functionality to changing “defaultLayout“, and if both are supplied then “defaultLayout” will take precedence
(From version 2.3)
If supplied, attempt to add the participant from the specified Call Bridge (from version 2.2).
If supplied, attempt to add the participant from the specified Call Bridge Group (from version 2.2).
The importance value of the participant to be created. Maximum value is 2,147,483,647. To remove importance leave the importance parameter as unset (leave value as blank). (From version 2.2)

If supplied, overrides the name for this participant. Setting an empty string clears the value and restores the original name. Overriding the name of a participant and its associated call leg(s) is interchangeable and affects both; the latest change takes precedence. It changes the name of the participant in the following: on-screen name label viewed by other conference participants, ActiveControl roster list, any place that the Meeting App sees the, name of the participant in a call, CDR records, where the name appears in the web interface. (From version 2.4)

A sequence of DTMF key press commands to send to the far end either when the participant is initially created or during the call. The DTMF sequence is played out from the Call Bridge where the call for this participant is placed. In the supplied sequence, you can use the digits 0 to 9, * and #, as well as one or more comma characters (“,“) which add a pause between digits. (From version 2.4)

item.name: Remove a participant from a specific call
Modifying properties for all participants in the conference

urlencoded.description: If true, mute the receiving of audio from all endpoints.
If true, mute the transmission of audio from all endpoints.
If true, mute (block) the receiving of video from all endpoints.
If true, mute (block)the transmission of video from all endpoints.
Set the importance of this participant already in a conference. For example to 1. (From version 2.2)

Optional comma-separated list of up to 20 participant ids to be either included or excluded from this operation (depending on value of 'mode' parameter. operation See More information on using bulk operation on participants. (From version 2.4)

If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “exclude.“

* exclude - the participant ids in filterIds are excluded from the operation
* selected - only the participant ids in filterIds are included in the operation See More information on using bulk operation on participants below.
(from version 2.4)

query.description: An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve callProfiles other than the first “page” in the notional list.

Supply “usageFilter=unreferenced” in the request to retrieve only those callProfiles that are not referenced by global settings or any other object. This is a useful check before deleting the profile. To retrieve just those callProfiles which are referenced in at least one place, you can supply “usageFilter=referenced“

urlencoded.description: from version 2.9
from version 3.0

query.description: An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve callLegs other than the first “page” in the notional list.
Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those callLegs that match the filter
return only call legs using the specified layout
return only call legs with this many or more available video streams
return only call legs with this many or fewer video streams
return only call legs which do, or do not, have an ownerID set
return only call legs with the specified alarm

request.description: POST to /callLegs/<call leg id>/generateKeyframe to trigger the generation of a new keyframe in outgoing video streams for the call leg in question. This is a debug facility, and Cisco Support may ask you to use the feature when diagnosing an issue.

query.description:
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve elements other than the
first “page” in the notional list

Supply “usageFilter=unreferenced” in the request to retrieve only those call leg profiles that are not referenced by global settings or any other object. This is a useful check before deleting the profile. To retrieve just those call leg profiles which are referenced in at least one place, you can supply “usageFilter=referenced“
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve callProfiles other than the first “page” in the notional list.

Supply “usageFilter=unreferenced” in the request to retrieve only those call branding profiles that are not referenced by global settings or any other object. This is a useful check before deleting the profile. To retrieve just those call branding profiles which are referenced in at least one place, you can supply “usageFilter=referenced“

An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve elements other than the

This is a useful check before deleting the profile. To retrieve just those DTMF profiles which are referenced in at least one place, you can supply “usageFilter=referenced“
Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those ivrs that match the filter

Supply “tenantFilter=<tenant id>” to return just those ivrs associated with that tenant

An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve elements other than the

item.name: Changing settings for a participant already in a conference

urlencoded.description: Set the importance of this participant already in a conference. For example to 1. (From version 2.2)
Set DTMF sequence to get played to this participant. (From version 2.4)
Override the name of this participant. (From version 2.4)

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those users that match the filter

An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve elements other than the
first “page” in the notional list
Supply an ID to return just those users associated with the specified tenant.
Supply emailFilter to restrict results returned to those users whose email value exactly matches the specified email address (from version 2.1).
Supply cdrTagFilter to restrict results returned to those users whose cdrTag value exactly matches the specified cdrTag (from version 2.1).

item.name: Retrieving Detailed Information on an Individual User
User Profile Methods

query.description:
An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve elements other than the
first “page” in the notional list

Supply “usageFilter=unreferenced” in the request to retrieve only those user profiles that are not referenced by global settings or any other object. This is a useful check before deleting the profile. To retrieve just those user profiles which are referenced in at least one place, you can supply “usageFilter=referenced“

item.description: User profiles control the facilities provided to the users in the profile, for instance whether they can create new coSpaces, create new calls, make phone calls, slave SIP endpoints, allowed to send and receive chat messages when in a point to point call with another user. For more information see also Section 14.

urlencoded.description: Full URL to which CDRs will be sent

UTC time RFC3339

request.description: A POST to “/webBridges/<web bridge id>/updateCustomization” node causes any configured customization archive for the specified Web Bridge to be re-retrieved and pushed to that Web Bridge. For example, this allows the contents of a customization archive to be changed, and for those changes to take effect without needing to restart either the Call Bridge or the Web Bridge.

query.description: An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve webBridges other than the first “page” in the notional list.

urlencoded.description: Optional name of the Call Bridge group

Whether or not Call Bridges in this Call Bridge group will attempt to load balance calls within the group. If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “false” (from version 2.1)

Whether or not incoming calls to coSpaces from Lync are load balanced within the Call Bridge Group. If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “false” (from version 2.1)
Whether or not calls from coSpaces should be load balanced within the group. If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “false” (from version 2.2)
Whether or not Cisco Meeting App calls to coSpaces should be load balanced within the group. If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “true” (from version 2.3)

Whether or not incoming calls with Record-Route SIP headers should be load balanced within the group. If this parameter is not supplied in a create (POST) operation, it defaults to “false” (from version 2.4)
Optional name of the Call Bridge group
Whether or not Call Bridges in this Call Bridge group will attempt to load balance calls within the group. (from version 2.1)
Whether or not incoming calls to coSpaces from Lync are load balanced within the Call Bridge Group. (from version 2.1)
Whether or not calls from coSpaces should be load balanced within the group. (from version 2.2)
Whether or not Cisco Meeting App calls to coSpaces should be load balanced within the group. (from version 2.3)
Whether or not incoming calls with Record-Route SIP headers should be load balanced within the group. (from version 2.4)

request.description: The uriUsageQuery method finds the coSpace, user and/or IVR using the specified URI within the specified tenant.

query.description: Supply “filter=<string>” in the URI to return just those participants that match the filter

An “offset” and “limit” can be supplied to retrieve participants other than the
first “page” in the notional list
